title: 103_hr3810
content: The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to include acquisition of lands, easements, and rights-of-ways necessary for construction of treatment works. It also expands eligibility for assistance to provide wastewater treatment and water supply services to communities. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" expands assistance to include innovative and cost-effective technologies in the construction of treatment works financed with assistance provided from the fund. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, including interest-free and negative-interest loans, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the project's useful life. Loans to these communities cannot exceed 15 percent of all loans made. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, including interest-free and negative-interest loans. Loans to these communities cannot exceed 15 percent of all loans made. Planning grants are also provided to cover up to 75 percent of planning and predevelopment costs for construction or improvement of treatment works in these communities. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act now allows for grants to rural and disadvantaged communities to cover up to 75 percent of planning and predevelopment costs for treatment works construction or improvement. The grants cannot exceed 2 percent of Federal grant awards to the water pollution control revolving fund in a fiscal year, with a maximum limit of $75,000 per project. The term 'disadvantaged communities' refers to a service area of a publicly owned treatment works defined by the State, excluding areas with a population over 10,000 and residents with a household income above 75% of the national median. A 'negative-interest loan' is a zero-interest loan provided by a State to rural and disadvantaged communities, with forgiveness of up to 20% of the principal over the loan term. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS amended to limit costs to 4% of total funds deposited into the fund in a fiscal year. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE introduces a grant program under Title VI of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE introduces a grant program under Title VI of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to provide training and technical assistance to rural and disadvantaged communities for treatment works. $15,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for this program from 1994 to 1998.
